Desc.entry: A registered charity which provides a non-discriminatory telephone listening service for parents/carers of children of all ages. Callers may remain anonymous. Aims to try to prevent physical and emotional abuse of children by giving callers an opportunity to talk over their problems. Also offers office appointments to speak to a volunteer. Runs two courses, an assertiveness course aimed at parents/carers with children aged 2-18 years and an effective parenting course for those with children under 7 years. Gives talks to local groups and other organisations and has a support group for parents which meets once per month. Self or any referral.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Appointments by arrangement, 1st Mon in the month at 7pm (support group)
